title: Rask scores in OT as Hurricanes beat Avalanche 1-0
text:
October 21, 2015 Rask scores in OT as Hurricanes beat Avalanche 1-0 Carolina Hurricanes goalie Cam Ward, right, reaches out to deflect shot off the stick of Colorado Avalanche left wing Alex Tanguay during the first period of an NHL hockey game Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015, in Denver. David Zalubowski AP Photo Carolina Hurricanes goalie Cam Ward makes a stick save of a shot against the Colorado Avalanche in the first period of an NHL hockey game Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015, in Denver. David Zalubowski AP Photo Colorado Avalanche defenseman Nikita Zadorov, left, of Russia, vies for control of the puck with Carolina Hurricanes center Victor Rask, of Sweden, during the second period of an NHL hockey game Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015, in Denver. David Zalubowski AP Photo Carolina Hurricanes center Jay McClement, left, reaches out to control the puck as Colorado Avalanche defenseman Nate Guenin pursues behind the net during the second period of an NHL hockey game Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015, in Denver. David Zalubowski AP Photo Carolina Hurricanes center Elias Lindholm, front, of Sweden, is checked by Colorado Avalanche defenseman Nick Holden while trying to dig the puck out of the corner during the second period of an NHL hockey game Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015, in Denver. David Zalubowski AP Photo 1 of 5 Order Reprint of this Story DENVER 
Victor Rask scored 1:49 into overtime, and the struggling Carolina Hurricanes beat the Colorado Avalanche 1-0 on Wednesday night. 
Cam Ward stopped 26 shots in his first shutout of the season and 23rd of his career. Ryan Murphy had the lone assist for Carolina, which won for just the second time in six games. 
The Hurricanes ended a 10-game losing streak in Denver. 
It was the first 3-on-3 overtime game for both teams. 
Colorado's second group in the extra period got caught on the ice, leading to the goal. Murphy fed Rask in the slot, and Rask took the puck to the front of the net and beat Semyon Varlamov with a backhander. It was Rask's second of the season. 
Varlamov finished with 18 saves. 
Jarome Iginla almost ended it early in overtime when he went alone into the Carolina zone. Ward made a save on the breakaway. 
Varlamov returned to the net after backup Reto Berra played two games. Varlamov entered Wednesday 1-2 with a 5.06 goals-against average. He was pulled from his last start after allowing five goals on 19 shots against Boston a week ago. 
He was much sharper against the Hurricanes, especially in the second period. He stopped center Elias Lindholm on a clear shot from the right circle and also made a glove save on Kris Versteeg's breakaway with 36 seconds left in the frame. 
He also stopped Nathan Gerbe on a breakaway in the first period. 
Matt Duchene nearly won it for Colorado late in regulation, but Ward made a stick save while face down on the ice. 
NOTES: Carolina D John-Michael Liles left the game late in the second period when he took a skate to the face from Iginla. He returned in the third period. ... Avalanche D Tyson Barrie served the second game of his three-game suspension for his hit on Anaheim D Simon Despres on Friday. ... The Hurricanes' last win in Denver was Feb. 16, 1996, when they were the Hartford Whalers. Related content
